moves.1. e4 Nh6: Hippopotamus opening; a favorite of mine.
moves.2. d3 g6 3. Bxh6: Last time someone did that, it cost them a Rook.
moves.3... Bxh6 4. Nf3 O-O 5. c3 e6: One downside to the Hippopotamus Opening is the weakness of the a2-g8 diagonal, if one plays the Hippo correctly. (Unlike me, this game)
moves.6. d4 d5: Getting ready to attack the center.
moves.7. e5 c6: This is about when I realized I still had a light-squared Bishop to develop! Oh, what a klutzy thing to do. Oh, well, no use crying over placed pawns.
moves.8. Bd3 Qb6 9. b3 c5: Freeing up my light-squared Bishop and attacking the center.
moves.10... cxd4 11. cxd4 Qb4+ 12. Nbd2: Oh, another game in which I have pinned a Knight in such a way!
moves.16. Bxf3: And maybe pick up a free Rook along the way.
moves.16... Qxa1: Down by a Rook and a pawn, White graciously resigns.
